forecast-period.text: A broad low pressure trough lies through inland parts of the Gascoyne and North Interior.

Wind gusts can be 40 percent stronger than the averages given here, and maximum waves may be up to twice the height. Wind warnings are issued for today and tomorrow and describe the highest category of wind warning for that day.
For latest warnings go to www.bom.gov.au, subscribe to RSS feeds, call 1300-360-223* or listen for warnings on relevant TV and radio broadcasts.
* Calls to 1300 numbers cost around 27.5c incl. GST, higher from mobiles or public phones. Marine forecasts are also available on VHF and HF radio. View the radio schedule on www.bom.gov.au/marine
Check the latest Coastal Waters Forecasts for information on wind, wave and weather conditions for neighbouring coastal zones

area.description: Pilbara Coast West: Cape Preston to North West Cape

forecast-period.text: Winds: West to southwesterly 10 to 15 knots, reaching up to 20 knots east of Onslow in the evening. Seas: Around 1 metre, increasing to 1 to 1.5 metres east of Barrow Island. Swell: West to southwesterly below 1 metre, increasing to 1 to 1.5 metres about offshore western waters. Weather: Clear.

Winds: West to southwesterly 15 to 20 knots. Seas: 1 to 1.5 metres, decreasing below 1 metre during the morning, then increasing to 1 to 1.5 metres during the afternoon. Swell: West to southwesterly below 1 metre, increasing to 1 to 1.5 metres about offshore western waters. Weather: Partly cloudy. 20% chance of a shower in Exmouth Gulf in the evening. Near zero chance of rain elsewhere.

Winds: Southwesterly 15 to 20 knots. Seas: 1 to 1.5 metres, decreasing to 1 metre during the morning, increasing to 1.5 metres east of Barrow Island during the afternoon. Swell: West to southwesterly below 1 metre, increasing to 1 to 1.5 metres about offshore western waters. Weather: Partly cloudy. 30% chance of a shower west of Onslow in the morning. Near zero chance of rain elsewhere. The chance of a thunderstorm in the morning.

Winds: South to southwesterly 15 to 20 knots. Seas: Around 1 metre, increasing to 1 to 1.5 metres offshore east of Barrow Island. Swell: West to southwesterly below 1 metre, increasing to 1 to 1.5 metres offshore west of Barrow Island during the afternoon. Weather: Partly cloudy.
